intro: Jamesbrittenia maxii, commonly known as the Maxwell's Jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
